member.name: F:yubikey.YubikeyAuth.modHex.ALPHABET
member.summary: Utility class for encoding and decoding Yubico's MODHex format.

remarks.para: MODHex is the format used to encode Yubikey authentication strings. Rather than the typical encoding formats, the alphabet used by MODHex (cbdefghijklnrtuv) has the advantage of being in the same location on all known keyboard layouts (or so YubiCo syas). This makes it ideal for encoding, since the YubiKey generates fake keyboard events to simulate typing by the user.
The general idea here are pretty much taken from the YubiCo-J project. However, the lookup-table-based implementation is new to this C# port.

member.name: M:yubikey.YubikeyAuth.modHex.Encode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes an octet stream in MODHex.
member.param: The bytes to be encoded. Must not be null.
member.returns: The encoded bytes. An empty array will return an empty string.

member.name: M:yubikey.YubikeyAuth.modHex.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a MODHex-encoded string back into an octet array.
member.param: The bytes to be decoded. May not be null, but an empty string is acceptable.
member.returns: The decoded data. If an empty string is passed in, then an empty array will be returned.
